conclusion: Determine the resultant Ampere force on the triangular conductor frame in a magnetic field.
Equilateral triangular conductor frame with uniform resistance wires, points A and B connected to a power supply, placed perpendicular to a magnetic field.
Ampere force on the AB section of the resistance wire is given as F.
Current distributes equally in the branches; current through AB is I, and through AC and BC is I/2.
Force on a current-carrying conductor in a magnetic field is F = I * L * B * sin(theta).
Force on AB is F_AB = I * L * B.
Force on AC and BC is F_AC = F_BC = (I/2) * L * B.
Forces on AC and BC are at 60 degrees to the force on AB; horizontal components oppose AB.
Horizontal component of force on AC is (I * L * B) / 4.
Horizontal component of force on BC is (I * L * B) / 4.
Total horizontal force opposing AB is (I * L * B) / 2.
Net force on AB is (I * L * B) / 2.
Resultant force on the entire frame is the same as the net force on AB.
Resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires is F/2.
